reviews.review: amazing game

Totally mindblown, nice storytwists, story driven progession, immersive² , awesome, junkie playthrough in 11 hours, felt like the game filled 40 hours worth of gameplay. Not to forget the awesome soundtrack, I got to get a copy of that.

Fans of system shock/dx/bioshock will freakishly worship this game.
Finally, I can eat food from bins without being accused of being homeless.

I really suggest everyone to play this game, at least for me it's doubtlessly game of the year and i really fallen in love with the story behind all that happens.
The setting, characters, plot, everything i saw in this game really shows that developers loved working on the game and all these details really make the game feel outstanding from everything i have seen over last years! O
Obviosly there are these moments that are quite awkward such as Elizabeth "Booker here's some cash" right after acting very upset and faithless, yet these kind of flaws are noticable only because the game was made so well that we expect it to be 100% perfect and that's not gonna happen, yet the game is really worth buying and characters, and story will stay within your minds for really long time.
10/10

Bioshock Infinite is the newist installment of Bioshock Series. Previouslly best known as a "escort" little girls simulator. You are now be task in escort this sexy girl on a date! During this date, you have to take care of her on an adventure though the fying city of Columbia. That also includes Shooting Cops/Bad-Guys, Riding a 1 hand Rollor Coasters, and using drugs! So you better make sure the date goes well or else you'll be forever alone!

8.5/10

From my favourite game franchise of all time, Bioshock Infinite takes itself to a whole new level that makes you rethink everything you know about the Bioshock universe (DLC included). Too much can be said, and little would be enough. Bioshock Infinite redefines what video games are.

[h1]Infinite[/h1]

Um dos shooters com enredo mais intrigante já vistos, te levando a querer cada vez mais nesse universo Bioshock que aqui chega ao final.

Perfeito em cada detalhe, valendo a compra inclusive de duas expansões!

Sensacional, fantástico, "mind-blowing"! Esse jogo reune tudo! Ótima arte, lindos gráficos, história fascinante e sólido gameplay. Fortemente recomendado, uma experiência única para ser desfrutada por todos. COMPRE, COMPRE, COMPREEE!

"So what is this game? Good or bad?"

"Why do you ask 'what'..."
"...when the delicious question is 'when'?"
"The only difference between past and present..."
"...is semantics."
"Buys, bought, will buy."
"Plays, played, will play."
"If we could perceive time as it truly was..."
"...what reason would grammar professors have to get out of bed?"


Those professors would still have to get out of bed, because Youtube comments are still a thing.  Snark aside, this is an excellent game. 

The gameplay is tight, if somewhat repetitive (shoot these guys, move along, shoot some more), and moves along quickly enough that you never really have time to get bored.  The exception to this formula are the segments with Skyhooks; these provide for some of the most visually impressive and entertaining fights in the game. Bottom line is that if you liked Bioshock 1/2, you'll like this, since it's essentially those but IN SPACE--uhh, in the sky.

The story...Ah, the story.  Probably the major selling point of the game, and while it can get a bit muddled at times, it definitely does not disappoint.  There are plenty of twists and turns along the way that, when combined with some well-placed references and one heck of an ending, make for one of the more memorable games in a while.  The atmosphere is great...and a bit disconcerting at times, especially when you stop for a second and just watch and listen.  As far as characters go, Booker is likeable enough and a welcome change from the Generic Bald Marine™ we see so much of these days, while Elizabeth makes for a fantastic change to the traditional escort mission with her complete invulnerability and ability to help in combat (although she does have a habit of throwing money directly at your head).  Both are well-developed, and you should find yourself invested in seeing what happens to them in the end.

All that said, I definitely recommend this game, and since you can usually catch it on sale for a crazy-low price, there's really no reason for Infinite to not be in your library.
if  you have play bioshock one and two this is a must :D

Прекрасная история длинною в 14+ часов. При желании найдется куча пустяков, к которым можно придраться, но вся прелесть в том, что делать этого совершенно не хочется. Хочется играть, пройти, а потом с надежой ждать after credits scene.

It is a bit short for a single player only game. It does have a very good story line. I would say wait for the game to become around $15 for your money’s worth. I took my time and finished in 9 hours.
Al intento 123... GAME OF THE YEAR!

Das Spiel selbst funktioniert weitestgehend so wie die beiden Vorgänger. Die Level sind allerdings viel schlauchartiger. Was aber der (für mich) entscheidende Punkt ist: Das Spiel ist eine einzige Anklage gegen die geheuchelte amerikanische Gottesgläubigkeit. Ein Land in dem ein Teenager im Knast landet weil er Geschlechtsverkehr hatte ein weißer Mörder aber unter dem Deckmäntelchen des 'First Strike' ungeschoren davonkommt. Und das hier ist nur die entschärfte Fassung! Auf Grund von zahlreichen Beschwerden (unter anderem auch der Entwickler selbst) hat Ken Levine die ursprünglich vorgesehene Version abgeändert. Den Leuten hat wohl nicht gepasst daß hier zu deutlich gezeigt wurde daß religiöser Fanatismus der beste Nährboden für Rassismus ist.

Sem contar que a Elizabeth é sensacional, te ajuda quando você mais precisa e está sempre falando contigo, difícil ficar sem ela! Sky lines muito divertidas! Trilha sonora de época sensacional! O melhor Bioshock é complicado escolher, os 3 são sensacionais! Mas acho que o Infinite se sobressaiu, inovou em relação aos outros...merece jogo do ano!

Bioshock Infinite, nečekal jsem, že na mě nějaká hra takhle zapůsobí. Je to příjemné pohlazení na nekonečném poli herních titulů. Tahle hra má akci, má příběh, má atmosféru, má city, a vše je to poskládané v ideální harmonii. Akce je zběsilá, rychlá, ale ne zmatená. Příběh má opravdu hloubku a po dohrání o něm budete stále přemýšlet. Atmosféra je kouzelná, celé město je umělecké dílo a mnohokrát se zastavíte a budete se kochat nádhernou estetikou. A city, všechno ve vás vyvolává nějaké pocity, hlavně postavy, nejsou to bezduché loutky, budete s nimi cítit, budete je nenávidět, budete je milovat. Nečekal jsem, že i dnes může vzniknout takový klenot. Vstoupil jsem do hry a vyšel jsem z ráje.

Aunque parezca un FPS del monton, Bioshock Infinite es un juego con una narrativa totalmente inmersiva, ya que tomas el papel de "Booker Dewitt" para ir a rescatar a "Elizabeth" de la ciudad utópica de Columbia que contrarresta lo visto en Rapture, aunque tu viaje comenzara tranquilo, no tardaras en encontrar problemas ya que Booker tiene una marca que lo convierte en "Falso Profeta", esto, acompañado de unos controles bien ejecutados, armas y plasmidos con buena variación y sus DLC, hacen de este juego un digno Bioshock

It really seems that they started with the setting and the twists (especially the twists) and the game is an afterthought. Still, despite being almost insultingly easy, linear and a little cobbled together (Plasms were key to the first bioshock's world, here they are basically tacked on and rarely mentioned) Bioshock infinite delivers a beautiful world, an interesting cast of characters and some really great moments that make the whole experience worthwhile.

Depois de jogá-lo e ver o quão maravilhoso esse game é, não tive dúvida que foi a melhor compra que fiz na Steam durante a Summer Sale. O enredo, gráfico e a trilha sonora, principalmente, deixa tudo em perfeita harmonia durante o desenrolar do jogo. Outro ponto importante é prestar atenção nos pequenos detalhes.

Prepare-se para ficar admirando Columbia e 'Elizabeth' por muito tempo enquanto joga. Além de ficar maravilhado e, talvez, confuso com o desfecho da história.

One of the best shooters of the previous generation. While it was hard for me to appreciate at first, replaying it really gave me a lot of perspective for why it is held in such high regard.

+ A blast to play through on Hard difficulty.
+ Elizabeth is one of the best companions in gaming. She provides you with indirect support, such as passing you ammo and health or opening tears. The game is quite smart about when Elizabeth has some extra ammo, health, or money to give you.
+ Tears in combat are neat and unique. You can change the environment to suit your needs. This supplements the already great level design.
+ The shotgun is the best gun in the game (especially when upgraded), and it's very fun to use.
+ Great graphics for the time as well as the excellent art design make this one of the best looking games of 2013, and probably the best looking game on Unreal Engine 3.
+ Well optimised. Looks great on both the lowest and the highest settings, and in both cases, the performance is buttery smooth. Plenty of graphics options as well.
+ Very punchy and satisfying weapon sound effects.
+ Comes with a built-in benchmark tool.
+ A unique and nearly unmatched combination of atmosphere, artistic direction, and setting.
+ Good story with many elements of environmental storytelling and plenty of additional audio logs to collect.

~ The story provides some choices to the player that have no consequences throughout the game, and even then, they are few and far in-between. It's better than having no choices, but it still feels half-assed.
~ The ending is a mind screw. It feels like it's confusing just for the sake of being confusing. However, it is deep and after the end of the game, you will think about it a lot.
~ The iron sights are toggled by MMB, instead of holding RMB like most FPS games. Fortunately, they're not necessary, most of the time.

- Most of the animation in the game is pretty mediocre (worse than BioShock 2, but better than BioShock 1), except for Elizabeth.
- The upgrade system is very expensive.
- Many of the vigors are highly situational, and you'd probably be best sticking with two (in my case, Possession and Devil's Kiss)
- Built-in aim assist that cannot be disabled by default. The aim assist forces your camera to center on the nearest enemy when you aim down sights. To disable it, you either need a controller (to access the controller settings in-game) or you need to tweak the game files (which didn't work for me).
- Some PC specific issues, such as [url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=vomP7Qf_tc4]textures loading in an infinite loop[/url]. I guess that's why they called it BioShock "Infinite".
- [url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=muJYTeQlvC4&list=FLyujXAa6fwmYF2M6utdPccg&index=219]Several promises were made by the dev team before release didn't come to fruition[/url].
- The "Infinite" in the title is misleading, the game does actually end. It's Finite.

Score: 8/10

Ideal price: $20

Gay as a Bioshock game, decent as a stand alone. 4.5/10

I'm not recommending this due to the fact, it's not Bioshock... And I loved Bioshock.
-You can only carry two guns, like most modern shooter crap on the market.
-Only two Vigors can be used.
-Regenerating shields made this game easy.
-Companion only good for throwing ammo and health at you. Pretty useless, dull, and unmemorable.
-Environments are boring, the good ones you spend 2 minutes strolling through, while the shit ones you spend 10 - 15 minutes in.

A city in the sky is more boring than a city submerged in water. This game is forgettable, the characters and gameplay are generic, the weapons are unfun, the vigors are shit (Spartan being the only good one.) and, like I said, the environments are boring. What is in the sky? Birds, clouds, and air. What is in the Ocean? Water, fish, sharks, jellyfish, starfish, squid, octopi, whales, and a lot more interesting things versus the sky. I made the mistake of buying this because it has Bioshock slapped on it, don't make my mistake.

If you are going to buy it, buy it cheap.

This game well deserves the praise it has recieved. Fantastic world, interesting characters, visceral combat, and a mind bending story come together in this game to make the experience that is Bioshock Infinite. Exploring the floating city of Columbia is quite something, all of the shops and such all have an interesting aesthetic. Half the fun of exploring it watching the reaction of the characters with their banter and conversations. All of the wonder turns into intensity once the combat comes into play with great gunplay and versatile Vigor abilities which can shape the battlefield. All of it wrapped into a story that will leave you stunned by the end. Highly recommended.
Just beat it in 9 hours, it was fun while it lasted... ending is a mind fuck, inception bioshock style...

The game has beautiful graphics so let me start by saying that.  I found it interesting that they still tied in water into this game even though it doesn't take place underwater.  It's a very interesting tie-in to its namesakes although it appears that this "story line" is over.  One could argue that it goes on indefinitely though that doesn't mean they'll do anything like it again, unless Ken Levine just wants more money.  The combat is on par with previous Bioshock games which means its good and its hard where it should be, but its not ground breaking.

As someone who has played System Shock 2, the combat and powers are good but I'm ready for something less dumbed down and I would hope that in the future, the consider something again with a more complex inventory system, something less consoley.  At this point it just has "shock" in the name but that's about it.  You do get cool powers but I didn't really feel a need to change them.  (Warning Pun)  Everything was more "watered down" (hah!)  in that you don't really need certain powers for any reason and you don't need different weapons for any reason.  I like armor piercing ammo for armored heavy targets.  Is that really too "hard" for people?

The ending I was able to call before I got to it, but I do admit I didn't know until toward the end.  I liked the female character but I couldn't figure out why my character was such a retarded jackass.  I fealt they forced you into decisions more so in this game than any other, probably because they wanted to set up a certain ending.  This is why I think they game is actually over, the story is done.  So on its own, it would have been really cool but it also just felt forced.  A shame because the Ken and his team (even if it evolves) does a really good job at telling a story.  The ending at least explains why you are forced in the direction you are.  Any other ending could potentially end up in the gross zone.

I would say play the game and have fun with it because it is a fun game.  Just don't have any expectations of anything radically different.

Its also great if you've never played a Bioshock game and thats something I admire, you don't have to know anything about the original game in order to enjoy this one. Amazing. It lives up to the original BioShock name that BioShock 2 had be skeptical about. Although I didn't play this game in one sitting, I could've had I not had other obligations. Unreal engine shows some age in this game, but the graphics are top notch on ultra. Textures/aliasing give a real blurry, unfinished look if you turn them down. Gameplay wise... perfect for non-RPG. Linear, but room to explore hidden secrets, locks, rooms. Elizabeth has the best AI for any companion in any game I've seen thus far 2013. Figuring out the plot will require some deep thinking :). Now go buy it!

Overall this means you need to BUY THIS GAME AND PLAY IT ALREADY!
